name: WebGoat
description: WebGoat is a deliberately insecure web application maintained by OWASP designed to teach web application security lessons.

name: w3af
description: Web Application Attack and Audit Framework. An open source web application security scanner which helps developers and penetration testers identify and exploit vulnerabilities in their web applications.

name: OWASP Juice Shop
description: OWASP Juice Shop: Probably the most modern and sophisticated insecure web application

name: HTTPS Everywhere
description: HTTPS Everywhere is a Firefox, Chrome, and Opera extension that encrypts your communications with many major websites, making your browsing more secure.

name: Apache Shiro
description: A powerful and easy-to-use Java security framework that performs authentication, authorization, cryptography, and session management
